result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eduardo Perales

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:07 AM Defendant Eduardo Perales in court.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court does not find the defendant indigent. Defendant to contact private counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:43 AM Defendant Eduardo Perales not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court does not order a warrant on defendant's nonappearance and continues to date already scheduled with Judge Grubb on October 21, 2022 at 10AM. Bond to continue.
Indigency hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance

2:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eduardo Perales appeared by video. Defendant did not qualify for public defender.  Defendant wants an attorney.

Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

4:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Eduardo Perales appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Eduardo Perales. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: Possess No weapons,  No contact with The Blue Aster, No contact directly or indirectly with victim BMG., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 1PM.
